page.title: 03Language in the Twyford Area
page.content: As in most areas the local dialect is disappearing as people move about from one area to another,watch television and listen to radio.The older generation of the local farming community still speak the local dialect but the true broad form was last commonly used by the parents of people now in their sixties and seventies. Some local words spoken in dialect are: wur = was of = off parst = past fust = first allus = always are = our "where be ye goin?" = "where are you going?" English is the native tongue of 99% of the people in our block.
